item.title: Public Health Officials Should Be Clearer About Who Isn't at Risk for Monkeypox
item.description:
Dear readers, I’ve seen a spate of pieces in recent days flagging the problem with “anyone can get monkeypox” messaging from public health authorities. (See, for example, Jerusalem Demsas in The Atlantic.) And part of what makes that message extra galling is that it’s not the only one public health officials are sending…

URL: https://www.joshbarro.com/p/public-health-officials-should-be?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Into the Metaverse!, &, OUTTAKE: Economic Policy: Contra von Hayek, Industrial Market Economies Do Not and Cannot Manage Themselves, &

item.title: The yield curve is predicting much worse than a recession.
item.description:
Here’s the yield curve in what we may call the forward-rates representation. Each of the five graphs in the chart are spreads along maturity — the number of years until the payment on a zero-coupon bond. The first is the yield on the 6-month (mo) bill less the yield on the 3-mo bill (anchored at the Fed’s current policy rate). The second is 1 year less …

URL: https://policytensor.substack.com/p/the-yield-curve-is-predicting-much?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: China's Unbalancing Is Going Into Overdrive
item.description:
China’s trade surplus is soaring thanks to “Covid Zero” and the ongoing crisis in the real estate sector. Domestic spending is being squeezed, which is holding down imports even as exports continue to hold up. The result is a great “unbalancing”, with debt rising relative to income and a smaller share of Chinese production enjoyed by ordinary Chinese…

URL: https://theovershoot.co/p/chinas-unbalancing-is-going-into?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: From the Cutting Room Floor: A Prologue to “Slouching Towards Utopia”, &

item.title: Mary the Tower
item.description:
July 22 is the Feast Day of Mary Magdalene, beloved of Jesus, and the “Apostle to the Apostles.” Earlier this week, I posted an audio of a sermon I delivered at the Wild Goose Festival on “All the Marys.” Within just a few hours after posting it here at The Cottage, it was downloaded nearly 10,000 times. Many listeners asked for a written text — here it…

URL: https://dianabutlerbass.substack.com/p/mary-the-tower?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: From the Cutting Room Floor: A Prologue to “Slouching Towards Utopia”, &

item.title: La Dolce Mailbag
item.description:

item.title: Will Merrick Garland Solve the Republicans’ Problem for Them?
item.description:
No TNB tonight: We’re watching the hearing at 8:00 p.m. and you should, too. 1. “Boosting,” Again Jonathan Swan made me lose my mind a little bit yesterday: I think this summary is somewhat misleading. Let me explain. If you read Swan’s summary and haven’t actually watched the ads, you might reasonably conclude that Democrats were running pro-Cox ads, in which they made an affirmative argument for Cox—or portrayed him as a good candidate—and that now Democrats have to “pivot” in their messaging to describe Cox as extreme…

URL: https://thetriad.thebulwark.com/p/will-merrick-garland-solve-the-republicans?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: From the Cutting Room Floor: A Prologue to “Slouching Towards Utopia”, &
